page.title: 14Aileen's Day-Castle Kennedy
page.content: I live on a farm in Wigtonshire. I wake up at 07.45. The cockerel wakens me so I go down and put on my grey school skirt and jumper. I eat tea and toast for breakfast. I take my dad's piece to the farm. It is cheese, bread and a flask of coffee. Then I return to get my playpiece. A playpiece is sweets or crisps but it used to be bread and jam. The school taxi comes and we collect Euan, Stuart and Gillian. We play rounders before the bell rings at 09.15. We do Maths. I am doing 24 hour clock. Tuck shop is at 10.30 then we go out to play at skipping or rounders. When we come in we do reading and history. We are studying the history of Scotland. At 12.30 the bell rings for lunch. We have mince and potatoes followed by fruit and custard.
